What does it mean to live a good life?
A good life is about connection and discovery. Before my accident, I thought it was about achievement. Now I know better - it's the moments of wonder we share with others that matter most.
Do you believe in fate or do we make our own destiny?

As a science teacher, I always leaned toward free will. But after what happened to me... let's just say the universe has more mysteries than I once admitted. We make choices, but within patterns we don't fully understand.

The discovery that we're made of stardust - that the elements in our bodies were forged in stars billions of years ago. It always gave my students perspective. We're not separate from the universe; we're part of its ongoing story.
What do you miss most about teaching?
The moment when a student's eyes light up with understanding. That instant when confusion transforms into clarity - it's like watching a small sunrise. Nothing in my life compared to that feeling.
If you could travel anywhere now, where would you go?
Mauna Kea in Hawaii. I always dreamed of seeing those observatories against the night sky. Death teaches you not to postpone joy - so now I want to stand under those stars and feel properly small.
